name: vscode-flowr
description: Slicing and analyzing R code courtesy of flowR

commands.title: Show Relevant Code for Dependency (Backward Slice)
Show Abstract Syntax Tree of the File
Show Control Flow Graph of the File
Show Relevant Code for Cursor Position Once (Backward Slice)
Show Influence for Cursor Position Once (Forward Slice)
Toggle Relevant Code Highlight at Current Position (Backward Slice)
Toggle Influence Highlight at Current Position (Forward Slice)
Toggle Relevant Code Highlight at Cursor (Backward Slice)
Toggle Influence Highlight at Cursor (Forward Slice)
Show Current Backward Slice in Editor (Reconstruct)

vscode-flowr.server.host.markdownDescription: The host to use when connecting to a [flowR server](https://github.com/flowr-analysis/flowr/wiki/Interface#-communicating-with-the-server).

vscode-flowr.server.port.markdownDescription: The port to use when connecting to a [flowR server](https://github.com/flowr-analysis/flowr/wiki/Interface#-communicating-with-the-server).

vscode-flowr.server.autoConnect.markdownDescription: Whether to auto-connect to a [flowR server](https://github.com/flowr-analysis/flowr/wiki/Interface#-communicating-with-the-server) when the extension is loaded.

enumDescriptions: The extension attempts to connect via websocket and automatically falls back to a TCP connection.
The extension connects to a flowR server via websocket (for a server started using --ws).
The extension connects to a flowR server via websocket over SSL/TLS (for a server started using --ws).
The extension connects to a flowR server via TCP.
vscode-flowr.server.connectionType.markdownDescription: The connection type that should be used when connecting to a [flowR server](https://github.com/flowr-analysis/flowr/wiki/Interface#-communicating-with-the-server). When running the extension in the browser, settings other than `websocket` and `websocket-secure` are ignored, as websocket mode is always used.

vscode-flowr.r.executable.markdownDescription: An absolute path to the R binary to use for the local shell. If this is empty, R is expected to be part of the system's PATH. This setting is ignored when running the extension in the browser, as tree-sitter mode is always used.

vscode-flowr.r.engine.markdownDescription: The flowR engine to use when parsi5ng R code. For more information, see the [engines documentation](https://github.com/flowr-analysis/flowr/wiki/Engines). This setting is ignored when running the extension in the browser, as tree-sitter mode is always used.

vscode-flowr.style.sliceOpacity.markdownDescription: The opacity that code which isn't part of the current slice should have, between 0 (invisible) and 1 (opaque).

enumDescriptions: Code that isn't part of the current slice will be grayed out in the active editor.
Open a diff view that shows the current slice and the rest of the file.
Highlight the tokens that are part of the current slice.
vscode-flowr.style.sliceDisplay.markdownDescription: The way that slices should be displayed.

vscode-flowr.style.tokenBackgroundColor.markdownDescription: The background color for highlighted tokens. This can be any valid CSS color, e.g. `#ff0000`, `rgb(255, 0, 0)`,`rgba(0, 127, 0, 0.5)`, `green`. Theme colors can be used as described [here](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/extension-guides/webview#theming-webview-content), e.g. `var(--vscode-editor-selectionBackground)`.

vscode-flowr.style.onlyHighlightActiveSe.markdownDescription: Whether to only highlight the selection in the active editor.

vscode-flowr.style.mermaidMaxTextLength.markdownDescription: The maximum amount of characters that a Mermaid graph can contain to be parsed and displayed.

vscode-flowr.tree-sitter.timeout.markdownDescription: How many milliseconds should the extension wait for the tree-sitter engine to start up?

vscode-flowr.tree-sitter.lax.markdownDescription: Should flowR use the lax parser for tree-sitter (i.e., allow for parsing errors)?

vscode-flowr.slice.automaticReconstruct.markdownDescription: Do you want to automatically view the reconstruction of every slice (i.e., see the standalone slice in an extra window)?

vscode-flowr.dependencyView.autoReveal.markdownDescription: If there are less than or equal the given dependencies in the dependency view, reveal them automatically.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Update the dependency view on every change in the active editor.
Update on every change until the source becomes too big, then switch to interval.
Update the dependency every n seconds, see `vscode-flowr.dependencyView.updateInterval`.
Update the dependency view only when the active editor is saved.
Never update the dependency view automatically.
vscode-flowr.dependencyView.updateType.markdownDescription: When to update the dependency view.

vscode-flowr.dependencyView.updateInterv.markdownDescription: Automatically update the dependency view every n seconds.

vscode-flowr.slice.revisitThreshold.markdownDescription: How often is flowR allowed to revisit, e.g., a function definition to infer more informations before it stops? Currently this only affects the internal session.

vscode-flowr.dependencyView.adaptiveChar.markdownDescription: The number of characters in the source after which the dependency view switches to interval updates.

vscode-flowr.dependencyView.cacheLimit.markdownDescription: The maximum number of dependency configurations to keep in the cache. This primarily improves the performance when you switch between files frequently (changing this clears the cache).

vscode-flowr.dependencyView.keepOnError.markdownDescription: Should the dependency view freeze when the code contains errors? If so, it will automatically retry on the next update (see `vscode-flowr.dependencyView.updateType`).

vscode-flowr.verboseLog.markdownDescription: Whether to use verbose logging while flowR is active (this will also redirect flowR logs to the output panel).

vscode-flowr.debug.flowrLogLevel.markdownDescription: What logging level should flowR use?

vscode-flowr.errorMessage.Timer.markdownDescription: The time in milliseconds after which an error message will be removed from the status bar.

vscode-flowr.config.ignoreSourceCalls.markdownDescription: Whether source calls should be ignored when analyzing code, causing files sourced using the `source` function to be skipped.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Use alias tracking to resolve values.
Only resolve directly assigned builtin constants.
vscode-flowr.config.solver.variableHandl.markdownDescription: How to resolve variables and their values when analyzing code.

vscode-flowr.config.solver.pointerTracki.markdownDescription: Whether to track pointers in the dataflow graph. If this is false, the graph will be over-approximated with regard to containers and accesses.

vscode-flowr.config.solver.resolveSource.markdownDescription: Find sourced files ignoring their capitalization?

enumDescriptions: Do not infer the working directory
Use the main script used for the analysis for the working directory
Use the active (sourced) script for the working directory
Consider all loaded scripts for the working directory
vscode-flowr.config.solver.resolveSource.markdownDescription: Which working directory to assume when resolving sourced files?
Which (additional) paths should be used to resolve sourced files?

enumDescriptions: Do not drop any parts of the path from a source
Drop the full path and only keep the filename if the path is not found.
Try every sub path in a source until a file is found.
vscode-flowr.config.solver.resolveSource.markdownDescription: How to handle paths in sources that are not found.

vscode-flowr.config.overwriteBuiltIns.lo.markdownDescription: When overwriting the builtin definitions of flowR, should the default configuration still be loaded?

vscode-flowr.config.overwriteBuiltIns.de.markdownDescription: When overwriting the builtin definitions of flowR, the set of additional definitions to load. For more info on how these need to be formatted, see [the wiki](https://github.com/flowr-analysis/flowr/wiki/Interface#%EF%B8%8F-configuring-flowr).

vscode-flowr.dependencyView.query.ignore.markdownDescription: When using the dependency view, should the set of functions that are detected by default be ignored/skipped?

vscode-flowr.dependencyView.query.overri.markdownDescription: When using the dependency view, the set of additional `libraryFunctions`, `sourceFunctions`, `readFunctions` and `writeFunctions` to load. For more info on how these need to be formatted, see [the wiki](https://github.com/flowr-analysis/flowr/wiki/Query-API#dependencies-query).

vscode-flowr.dependencyView.query.enable.markdownDescription: When using the dependency view, which dependency categories should be detected. Can also be toggled by right-clicking on a category in the dependency view itself.

vscode-flowr.linter.enabledRules.markdownDescription: The names of the linting rules that should be enabled. See [the wiki](https://github.com/flowr-analysis/flowr/wiki/Linter#linting-rules) for a list of linting rules and their identifiers. An empty array causes all linting rules to be enabled.

vscode-flowr.linter.ruleConfigs.markdownDescription: Custom configurations for enabled linting rules. See [the wiki](https://github.com/flowr-analysis/flowr/wiki/Linter#linting-rules) for a list of linting rules and their configurations. Entries should use rule names as keys and configurations as vaules, for example: `{ "naming-convention": { "caseing": "snake_case" } }`.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Update the linter on every change in the active editor.
Update on every change until the source becomes too big, then switch to interval.
Update the linter every n seconds, see `vscode-flowr.linter.updateInterval`.
Update the linter only when the active editor is saved.

vscode-flowr.linter.updateInterval.markdownDescription: Automatically update the linter every n seconds (used by adaptive and interval).

vscode-flowr.linter.adaptiveCharacterLim.markdownDescription: The number of characters in the source after which the linter switches to interval updates.

vscode-flowr.diagram.defaultSync.markdownDescription: If set to true, mermaid diagrams are automatically synced to the selected lines of code in the respective editor by default

markdownEnumDescriptions: Selected lines are highlighted in the diagram
Only selected lines are shown in the diagram

viewsWelcome.contents:
Welcome to flowR!
Open an R file to see its dependencies.

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run package && npm run package-web
scripts.copy-wasm-node: mkdir -p dist/node && cp node_modules/web-tree-sitter/tree-sitter.wasm dist/node && cp node_modules/@eagleoutice/tree-sitter-r/tree-sitter-r.wasm dist/node
scripts.copy-wasm-web: mkdir -p dist/web && cp node_modules/web-tree-sitter/tree-sitter.wasm dist/web && cp node_modules/@eagleoutice/tree-sitter-r/tree-sitter-r.wasm dist/web
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run lint
